doc.field: Project Files measure 11 linear feet and reflect the representation of third district concerns in Congress, the monitoring of industry within the district and the solicitation of grants & legislation to benefit the district. To a lesser extent, some files also contain case files that have significance beyond the individuals involved. Materials include memoranda, copies of project proposals and grant applications, news releases, notes, news clippings, and correspondence. For additional grant award announcements and notifications from various federal agencies, see Subseries II: Subject/Agency files labeled "Contracts and Grants."

Files are organized alphabetically by company name, topic, or town/county name. Projects concern subjects such as industrial development, public works projects, road maintenance and tolls, employment, community development, and environmental issues. As projects sometimes lead to legislative action, the distinction between project and legislative work is not always clear. Researchers should also consult the Topical files in the Legislative series for additional information.
Series V: Constituent Services >> Subseries III: Project
